intro: Viola faurieana f. albifaurieana, commonly known as the white-furred violet, is a horticultural form of the viola genus characterized by its distinctive white or pale violet petals. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value, featuring showy flowers that bloom in early spring. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with heart-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. It is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
